headline: Dr Oz. releases bizarre attack ad on opponent David McCormick mocking hard seltzer, vests and 'finance bros' - claiming he puts China over voters in Pennsylvania
author: Nikki Schwab

'If Biden wants to politicize health, he'll have to fire me': Trump-era appointee Dr Oz refuses President's demand to resign from federal advisory committee
The White House wrote a letter Wednesday to both Dr. Mehmet Oz and Herschel Walker - both of whom are running as Republicans for Senate this year - on behalf of President Joe Biden, demanding they resign from the President's Council on Sports, Fitness & Nutrition or be fired.

After an NFL career with brief sidetracks into Olympic bobsleigh and MMA, Walker has become a heavy hitter in Georgia politics, serving as an honorary co-chair of Senator Kelly Loeffler's failed re-election campaign.Trump encouraged Walker to run and has fully endorsed his campaign in the Republican primary.

The current appointees feature several former sports greats who have been publicly connected to former President Donald Trump: New York Yankees legend Mariano Rivera; longtime New England Patriots coach Bill Belichick; and Trump communications strategist Dan Scavino.

Walker, on the other hand, has a long history with Trump that dates back to the ex-president's tenure as the owner of the New Jersey General in the ill-fated NFL rival United States Football League from 1983 to 1985.

According to the Department of Health, the council's mission is 'to increase sports participation among youth of all backgrounds and abilities and to promote healthy and active lifestyles for all Americans.'
Oz, 61, is the former host of a popular syndicated medical talk show and is running for Senate in Pennsylvania; Walker, 60, was a 2-time Pro Bowl running back in the NFL and is running in Georgia.
McCormick's record on China is being used against him in the race, where GOP candidates are trying to stay in line with former President Donald Trump's 'America First' policies.
He also backed bringing in high-skilled immigrants to the U.S. and was pro-free trade and globalization versus 'Buy USA' protectionism, according to the Philadelphia Inquirer.
Dr. Mehmet Oz's Pennsylania Senate campaign put out an attack ad Wednesday hitting rival David McCormick for being a 'finance bro,' a carpetbagger and too cozy with China.
Oz - the celebrity heart surgeon best known as daytime TV´s host of 'The Dr. Oz Show' - is attempting to win the Republican nomination in Pennsylvania over Dave McCormick.
The latest Pennsylvania GOP Senate primary poll, conducted by Fox, has McCormick leading the pack with 24 per cent support, with Oz coming in second with 15 per cent.
Oz has also had to deal with the carpetbagger charge, as the celebrity doctor and television star has lived in a New Jersey mansion for more than three decades.
The ad did so by casting two vest-wearing, hard seltzer-drinking 'bros' named Tad and Chad, who called McCormick - a former hedge fund manager - their 'hero.'
'He's the wolf of Westport, Connecticut,' Chad says of McCormick, who was born in Pennsylvania, but has lived in the ritzy New York City exurb since 2009.
It reads: 'On behalf of President Biden, I am writing to request your resignation as a Member of the President's Council on Sports, Fitness & Nutrition.
It was announced earlier Wednesday that Chef Jose Andres and WNBA star Elena Delle Donne had been appointed to replace Walker as the council chair.
Speaking to the Hartfort Courant - a Connecticut newspaper - in January, McCormick bristled at the idea that he's 'coming back' to Pennsylvania.
Oz says he's a Pennsylvanian now as he moved last year to the Montgomery County home owned by his wife's parents in suburban Philadelphia.
He's also pushed back against being labeled a carpetbagger - a candidate who runs for office in a place where he or she doesn't live.
In the past, McCormick talked up China's economic growth and said he saw opportunities for the U.S. to tap into China's market.
Dr. Oz responded on Twitter, saying he had been appointed twice to the council by President Trump and had no plans to resign.
The ad shows imagery of McCormick and Chinese President Xi Jinping - and the 'bros' running around with Chinese flags.
Should we not receive your resignation, your position with the Council will be terminated effective 6 p.m. tonight.
Yuengling boasts that it's the oldest brewery in the United States and is based in Pottsville, Pennsylvania.
More recently he expressed wariness about China's rise - and praised Trump's moves against the giant.
'Dave's more than another finance bro - he's China's bro,' Tad and Chad say as the ad concludes.
Most of the council was appointed for two-year terms under Trump in late 2020 and early 2021.
'The doctor he should ask to resign is Dr. Fauci, for a multitude of obvious reasons.'
'It's sad that he would politicize such an important issue like health,' he tweeted.
McCormick purchased a home outside of Pittsburgh before officially joining the race.
And Pennsylvania’s the place where I’ve had the most formative life experiences.'
The White House's letter gave no reason for why they were being asked to resign.
Oz's closest Trump-allied endorsements come from Rudy Giuliani and Sean Hannity.
I’m a seventh generation Pennsylvanian, so I feel like Pennsylvania is my home.
Please submit your resignation to me by the close of business today.
'Well, for me, I’m not coming back,' the Republican hopeful said.
'Do you think Dave McCormick actually has to drink Yuengling?'
Chad asks, as the two guzzle down shots and hard seltzers.
'Pennsylvania’s been my home for more than half my life.
Do you think they have hard seltzer there?'
Many of my friends are in Pennsylvania.
My family’s in Pennsylvania.

Thank you.'
Tad asks.
'China?
